wobani.resources.mesh

Class StaticMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • wobani.resources.mesh.StaticMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Mesh, Renderable, Resource

    public class StaticMesh
extends java.lang.Object
implements Mesh
    Stores a mesh's data. You can load a mesh only once, if you try to load it twice, you get reference to the already loaded one. You can specify the StaticMesh's data store policy including when and where the data should be stored.
    See Also:
    loadModel(File path)

    • Method Detail

      • loadModel

        @NotNull
public static java.util.List<StaticMesh> loadModel(@NotNull
                                                             java.io.File path)
        Loads a model from the given path into meshes. You can load a mesh only once, if you try to load it twice, you get reference to the already loaded one.
        Parameters:
        path - model's relative path (with extension like "res/models/myModel.obj")
        Returns:
        list of model's meshes

      • loadModelToGameObjects

        @NotNull
public static java.util.List<GameObject> loadModelToGameObjects(@NotNull
                                                                          java.io.File path)
        Loads a model from the given path into meshes, and adds each mesh as a OldMeshComponent to it's own GameObject.
        Parameters:
        path - model's relative path (with extension like "res/models/myModel.obj")
        Returns:
        list of GameObjects

      • loadModelToGameObject

public static GameObject loadModelToGameObject(@NotNull
                                                         java.io.File path)
        Loads a model from the given path into meshes, and adds all the meshes as MeshComponents to a single GameObject.
        Parameters:

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        Draws this Renderable. Note that before calling this method, you should start a shader program, enable vertex attributes, send uniform variables to the GPU and bind this mesh's VAO. Usually only Renderers calls this method.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Renderable

        Specified by:
        afterDraw in interface Renderable

      • getVramTimeLimit

        public long getVramTimeLimit()
        Returns the ACTION time limit. If the elapsed time since this mesh's last use is higher than this value and the mesh's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION. Later if you want to render this mesh, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        ACTION time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setVramTimeLimit

        public void setVramTimeLimit(long vramTimeLimit)
        Sets the ACTION time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this mesh's last use is higher than this value and the mesh's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION. Later if you want to render this mesh, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        vramTimeLimit - ACTION time limit (in miliseconds)

      • getRamTimeLimit

        public long getRamTimeLimit()
        Returns the RAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this mesh's last use is higher than this value and the mesh's data store policy is HDD, the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM. Later if you want to render this mesh, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setRamTimeLimit

        public void setRamTimeLimit(long ramTimeLimit)
        Sets the RAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this mesh's last use is higher than this value and the mesh's data store policy is HDD, the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM. Later if you want to render this mesh, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        ramTimeLimit - RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • getState

        @NotNull
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getState()
        Returns the mesh's state. It determines where the mesh is currently stored.
        Returns:
        the mesh's state

      • getDataStorePolicy

        @NotNull
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getDataStorePolicy()
        Returns the mesh's data store policy. ACTION means that the mesh's data will be stored in ACTION. RAM means that the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM if it's rarely used. Later if you want to render this mesh, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        the mesh's data store policy

      • setDataStorePolicy

        public void setDataStorePolicy(@NotNull
                               ResourceManager.ResourceState minState)
        Sets the mesh's data store policy to the given value. ACTION means that the mesh's data will be stored in ACTION. RAM means that the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION to RAM if it's rarely rendered. HDD means that the mesh's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM if it's rarely rendered. Later if you want to render this mesh, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        minState - data store policy

        Returns the time when the mesh last time used.

        the time when the mesh last time used (in miliseconds)

      • getRadius

        public float getRadius()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        Returns the distance between the origin and the furthest vertex. This value is not depends on a GameObject's scale (object space), so if you scale the mesh, this method gives you wrong value. If you want to get the scaled value of the furthest vertex distance (what is depends on the GameObject's scale), use the MeshComponent's or SplineComponent's getScaledFurthestVertexDistance() method.
        Specified by:
        getRadius in interface Renderable
        Returns:
        furthest vertex distance
        See Also:
        MeshComponent#getRealFurthestVertexDistance(), SplineComponent#getRealFurthestVertexDistance()
